731081f.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [R. Hoe and Company.]
731081f.text:
The Williamsburg (East River) Bridge under construction as viewed southeastward from the Manhattan shore. In the foreground is the area that will be cleared (1939) for the East River Drive. The R. Hoe and Company foundry on the right will shortly be removed.
About 1903-4
Ewing Galloway
Neg.~ 2835

731087f-a.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [Ferry house.]
731087f-a.text:
(1)
Williamsburg Bridge, as seen from foot of Grand Street, looking east to Brooklyn.
March 1929.
Wugene L. Armbruster, Collectien.
(2)
The same, from different angle, showing the ruins of the ferry-house, which burned.
March 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.

731087f-b.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [Ferry house.]
731087f-b.text:
(1)
Williamsburg Bridge, as seen from foot of Grand Street, looking east to Brooklyn.

Wugene L. Armbruster, Collectien.
(2)

731090f-a.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge [spans the East River, beginning at Delancey Street in Manhattan and terminating in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.]
731090f-a.text:
(1)
The Williamsburg Bridge spans the East River; beginning at Delancey Street, in Manhattan, and terminating in the Williamshurg section of Brooklyn. The view taken from East 5th Street Dock, looking southeastward.
June 10, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2) The same; as seen from dock at foot of Stanton Street, in Manhattan,
looking toward Brooklyn.
June 10, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

June 10, 1933.

731097f-a.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [View of the bridge from Stanton and Rivington Streets.]
731097f-a.text:
Williamsburg Bridge as photographed southeastward from the Manhattan side of the East River. In the foreground is the newly constructed East River Drive and marginal park. These rest upon filled ground. The photographers vantage point is at Stanton and at Rivington St's.
June 1, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

731097f-b.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [View of the bridge from Stanton and Rivington Streets.]
731097f-b.text:
Williamsburg Bridge as photographed southeastward from the Manhattan side of the East River. In the foreground is the newly constructed East River Drive and marginal park. These rest upon filled ground. The photographers vantage point is at Stanton and at Rivington St's.
June 1, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr

731099f-c.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [East River - Manhattan.]
731099f-c.text:
Williamsburg Bridge, seen from Manhattan.
P.L. Sperr
1939
Views 1-5

731099f-a.text:

731100f-a.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge [spans the East River, beginning at Delancey Street in Manhattan and terminating in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.]

731082f.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - East River.
731082f.text:
Williamsburg Bridge over East River.
B. H. Hellmich  no date

731083f.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - East River - [Construction.]
731083f.text:
Williamsburg Bridge over East River under construction looking
in a southeast direction from Mnhattan.
B. H. Hellmich  no date

731084f.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - East River (West) - [Construction.]
731084f.text:
Williamsburg Bridge viewed looking westwardly across the East River.
Hellmich, Photographer  no date

731085f.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - East River - [Construction.]
731085f.text:
Williamsburg Bridge across the East River under construction. It was begun November 7, 1896 and opened December 19, 1903. Construction cost $15,091,497, and land $9,096,593. Total.
$24,188,O90.
B. H. Hellmich  no date

731086f-c.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - Brooklyn [Kent Avenue - Construction.]
731086f-c.text:
(1) Williamsburg Bridge across East River. This view, taken from about Kent Ave., Brooklyn, shows its construction.
About 1903.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
A view from the Manhattan side and showing the brick and steel underpinning. The road bed proper is shown projecting eastward to Brooklyn.
March 5, 1937.
Geo. D. Chinn.
(3)
The same from an angle.
March 5, 1937.
Geo. D. Chinn.

731088f-a.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [Fireboat William L. Strong ; Engine 66.]
731088f-a.text:
(1)
Williamsburg Bridge, showing its western section near the shore of Manhattan.
March 24, 1931.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date. Also shown is the fireboat William L. Strong docked at the fireboat house Engine 66, at the foot of Grand Street
January 14, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

731088f-b.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [Fireboat William L. Strong ; Engine 66.]

731089f-b.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [Grand Street ferry house.]
731089f-b.text:
(1)
The western tower of the Williamsburg Bridge; in the center is part of the old Grand Street ferry-house, at the foot of Broome Stree, now used by a boat club.
April 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same. A view taken after the destruction of the ferry slip.
January 14, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Another view of the bridge looking towards Brooklyn.
June 10, 1933.
L. Sperr.

731092f-c.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge [spans the East River, beginning at Delancey Street in Manhattan and terminating in Williamsburg, Brooklyn - View of the Bridge, showing Tugboat El Chico; Oil barge Sunoco 3; Yacht North Star; Dredge barge.]
731092f-c.text:
(1)
Villiamsburg Bridge taken from Manhattan; looking southeastward at Brooklyn. The tug boat 'El Chico' and the oil barge 'Sunoco 3', are
seen passing north under the bridge.
September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)  The Brooklyn shore line at the Williamsburg Bridge, as seen from East 3rd Street Dock, in Manhattan. The yacht "North Star" is also
seen in the foreground.
June 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, showing the Dredge Barge 'Governor Warfield'.
September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

731093f-b.title: Bridges - Williamsburg Bridge - [Corlears Hook - Fireboat William L. Strong, Engine 66 - Grand Street.]
731093f-b.text:
(1)
Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge, showing Corlears Hook.
September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view of the bridge. Also shown is the Fire Department boat "William L. Strong" at the foot of Grand Street.
March 31, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

Water Street, at Scammel looking towards Williamsburg Bridge, across clearing.

September 18, 1935.
